```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE, dev = 'pdf')
# Load libraries and data
library(survey)
library(RColorBrewer)

#Data - Vietnam Era  Veterans Survey Design Object
viet_design <- readRDS("Data_Viet_Design.Rds")

#Data - Age Over 55 Civilian Population Survey Design Object
per55_design <- readRDS("Data_Per55_Design.Rds")

#Data - Housing Vietnam Vets
hou_viet_design <- readRDS("Data_Hou_Viet_Design.Rds")

#Data - Housing Age Over 55 Civilian Population
hou55_design <- readRDS("Data_Hou55_Design.Rds")

#Data - Vietnam Era Veterans GQ Survey  Desgn Object
viet_gq_design <- readRDS("Data_Per_Viet_GQ_Design.Rds")

#Data - General Populaiton GQ Survey  Desgn Object
per55_gq_design <- readRDS("Data_Per55_GQ_Design.Rds")

#Data - Utilization data for Vietnam Vets
uvr15 <- read.csv("UVR_2015_161212_VietVet.csv", sep=",", stringsAsFactors=FALSE)

#Graph stuff
#create var to reset graphical parameters
opar <-par(no.readonly=TRUE)

#Paired color vector to comparisons 
mycols <- brewer.pal(n=12, name = "Paired")

```

```{r age_setup, include=FALSE}
#calculate vietnam vet total (counts)
viet.total <- svytotal(~Period, viet_design)
#calculate median age for vietnam vets
agep.v.qt <- svyquantile(~AGEP, viet_design, quantiles = c(0.5))
#calculate median age for Civilian Population
agep.gp.qt <- svyquantile(~AGEP, per55_design, quantiles = c(0.5))

#calculate age means (percentage) for vietnam vets, extract std errors
age.v <- svymean(~Ager, viet_design)
age.se.v <- SE(age.v)[6:10]
age.v <- age.v[6:10]
#calculate age means (percentage) for Civilian Population, extract std errors
age.gp <- svymean(~Ager, per55_design)
age.se.gp <- SE(age.gp)[6:10]
age.gp <- age.gp[6:10]

#significance test if z < -1.96 or Z>1,96, results are significant at the 95 confidence level
age.z <- c() 
for(i in 1:length(age.v)){
zscore<- (age.v[i]-age.gp[i])/sqrt(age.se.v[i]^2+age.se.gp[i]^2)
age.z <- c(zscore, age.z)
if(all(age.z > 1.96 | age.z < -1.96)==TRUE) age.zscore <- "Differences are significant at the 95% confidence level" else age.zscore <- "Differences are not significant."
}

#multiply by 100 to get percentages
age.v <- age.v*100
age.gp <- age.gp*100

```

```{r sex_setup, include=FALSE}
#calculate sex means (percentage) for vietnam vets, extract std errors
sex.v <- svymean(~SEX, viet_design)
sex.se.v <- SE(sex.v)
#calculate sex means (percentage) for Civilian Population, extract std errors
sex.gp <- svymean(~SEX, per55_design)
sex.se.gp <- SE(sex.gp)

#significance test if z < -1.96 or Z>1,96, results are significant at the 95 confidence level
sex.z <- c() 
for(i in 1:length(sex.v)){
zscore<- (sex.v[i]-sex.gp[i])/sqrt(sex.se.v[i]^2+sex.se.gp[i]^2)
sex.z <- c(zscore, sex.z)
if(all(sex.z > 1.96 | sex.z < -1.96)==TRUE) sex.zscore <- "Differences are significant at the 95% confidence level" else sex.zscore <- "Differences are not significant."
}
#multiply by 100 to get percentages
sex.v <- sex.v*100
sex.gp <- sex.gp*100

#calculate GP totals by sex (used in slide header)
sex.gp.tot <- (svytotal(~SEX, per55_design))/1000000
```


## Data Sources: American Community Survey (ACS) and U.S. Veterans Eligibility Trends and Statistics, 2015 (USVETS 2015)
* The primary data source is the [\textcolor{blue}{2015 ACS Public Use Microdata Sample (PUMS)}](https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/acs/data/pums.html). USVETS 2015 is used to provide a view into utilization of VA services. 
    * The ACS is an ongoing survey that provides annual data on the social and economic characteristics of the U.S. population.
    * The ACS uses a series of monthly samples to produce annually updated data for the same small areas (census tracts and block groups)formerly surveyed via the decennial census long-form sample.
    * Data on the utilization of VA services is provided by USVETS 2015.

* All comparative statements (Vietnam Veterans vs. Civilian Population) have undergone statistical testing according to the [\textcolor{blue}{method prescribed in the ACS technical documentation}](https://www2.census.gov/programs-surveys/acs/tech_docs/statistical_testing/2015StatisticalTesting1year.pdf). Results are significant at the 95% confidence level.
    * A statistically significant difference simply means there is statistical evidence that there is a difference; it does not mean the difference is necessarily large, important or significant in the usual sense of the word.
    * No statistically significant difference means that there is statistical evidence that there is no difference in the comparative percentages/rates.
    
* Race categories are shown for the non-Hispanic population (e.g., White non-Hispanic, Black non-Hispanic, Asian non-Hispanic). Hispanics can be of any race.
    * The Native Hawaiians and Pacific Islanders category is abbreviated as "NHOPI". They are also grouped together with the "Asian" category.
    * Other includes individuals who reported as belonging to "Some Other Race" or "Two or More Races".
    * American Indians and Alaska Natives are grouped together and are abbreviated as "AIAN"
    
* For more information about the ACS please visit the [\textcolor{blue}{U.S. Census Bureau webiste}](http://www.census.gov/acs).

                                                       

## Notes on Comparing Vietnam Veterans to Non-Veterans

* Between 1964 and 1973, there were roughly 8.8 million[^1] personnel, composed of both volunteers and draftees, who served in the Vietnam War. As of 2015 there are an estimated `r round(viet.total[[5]]/1000000, digits=1)`M Veterans. 
\newline
* Estimates reported here do not represent the number of troops deployed, killed, or wounded. They only represent Veterans who responded to the ACS in 2015. 
\newline
* Vietnam War Veterans are identified through the variable Veteran Period of Service (VPS) where respondents answered with either Vietnam Era/Korean War/WWII, Vietnam War/Korean, or Vietnam War. 
\newline
* Vietnam Veteran ages range from `r min(viet_design$variables$AGEP)` to `r max(viet_design$variables$AGEP)` years old. In order to make equitable comparisons, these Veterans are compared with the civilian population of the same age group. Both groups are likely to exhibit characteristics that are associated with that age cohort.
\newline
* Vietnam Veterans are predominantly men (`r round(sex.v[1], digits=0)`%) whereas non-Veterans are mostly women (`r round(sex.gp[2], digits=0)`%). Any characteristic (e.g. income) associated with sex will be affected by the inherent differences amongst men and women. 
  
[^1]:[U.S. Department of Commerce, Bureau of the Census, "Vietnam Conflictâ€”U.S. Military Forces in Vietnam and Casualties Incurred: 1961 to 1972," table 590, Statistical Abstract of the United States, 1977 (Washington, D.C.: U.S. Department of Commerce, Bureau of the Census, 1980), 369.](https://www2.census.gov/library/publications/1977/compendia/statab/98ed/1977-05.pdf)

## Non-Hispanic Whites are the largest racial group amongst Vietnam Veterans and Civilian Population.

```{r race_setup}
#calculate racenhc means (percentage) for vietnam vets, extract std errors

#calculate racenhc means (percentage) for Civilian Population, extract std errors
racenhc.gp <- svymean(~RaceNHC, per55_design)
racenhc.se.gp <- SE(racenhc.gp)

#significance test if z < -1.96 or Z>1,96, results are significant at the 95 confidence level
racenhc.z <- c() 
for(i in 1:length(racenhc.v)){
  zscore<- (racenhc.v[i]-racenhc.gp[i])/sqrt(racenhc.se.v[i]^2+racenhc.se.gp[i]^2)
  racenhc.z <- c(zscore, racenhc.z)
  if(all(racenhc.z > 1.96 | racenhc.z < -1.96)==TRUE) racenhc.zscore <- "Differences are significant at the 95% confidence level" else racenhc.zscore <- "Differences are not significant."
}
#multiply by 100 to get percentages
racenhc.v <- racenhc.v*100
racenhc.gp <- racenhc.gp*100

```

```{r marital_setup}
mar.gp <- mar.gp*100
```

## A third of Vietnam Veterans are more than 70% disabled. Though their disability is not necessarily service connected.

```{r dis_setup}

#Disability Recode (DIS) VIETNAM VETERANS extract std errors
dis.v <- svymean(~DIS, viet_design)
dis.se.v <- SE(dis.v)
#Disability Recode (DIS) Civilian Population, extract std errors
dis.gp <- svymean(~DIS, per55_design)
dis.se.gp <- SE(dis.gp)

#significance test if z < -1.96 or Z>1,96, results are significant at the 95 confidence level
dis.z <- c() 
for(i in 1:length(dis.v)){
  zscore<- (dis.v[i]-dis.gp[i])/sqrt(dis.se.v[i]^2+dis.se.gp[i]^2)
  dis.z <- c(zscore, dis.z)
  if(all(dis.z > 1.96 | dis.z < -1.96)==TRUE) dis.zscore <- "Disability status differences are significant at the 95% confidence level" else dis.zscore <- "Disability status differences are not significant."
}
#multiply by 100 to get percentages
dis.v <- dis.v*100
dis.gp <- dis.gp*100

```

```{r dratx_setup}

## Veterans Service Connected Disability Rating (DRATX)
dratx.v <- svymean(~DRATX, viet_design)*100

## Veteran Service Connected Disability STATUS (DRAT)
drat.v <- svymean(~DRAT, viet_design, na.rm = TRUE)*100

# No sig test since these variables are not compared with the Civilian Population

```

## Less than 2% of Vietnam Veterans live group quarters*. More Veteran households headed by married couples relative to the civilian population.

```{r gq_setup}

#Group Quarters VIETNAM VETERANS
gq.v <- svytotal(~TYPE, viet_gq_design)
#Housing Units VIETNAM VETERANS
hu.v <- svytotal(~TYPE, hou_viet_design)
#Combine GQ and Housing Unit for Vietnam VETERANS
type.v <- c(hu.v[1], gq.v[2:3])
#Extract Std. Errors
type.se.v <- c(SE(hu.v)[1], SE(gq.v)[2:3])
rm(gq.v, hu.v)

#Group Quarters Civilian Population
gq.gp <- svytotal(~TYPE, per55_gq_design)
#Housing Units Civilian Population
hu.gp <- svytotal(~TYPE, hou55_design)
#Combine GQ and Housing Unit for Civilian Population
type.gp <- c(hu.gp[1], gq.gp[2:3])
#Extract Std Errors
type.se.gp <- c(SE(hu.gp)[1], SE(gq.gp)[2:3])
rm(gq.gp, hu.gp)

#significance test if z < -1.96 or Z>1,96, results are significant at the 95 confidence level
type.z <- c() 
for(i in 1:length(type.v)){
  zscore<- (type.v[i]-type.gp[i])/sqrt(type.se.v[i]^2+type.se.gp[i]^2)
  type.z <- c(zscore, type.z)
  if(all(type.z > 1.96 | type.z < -1.96)==TRUE) type.zscore <- "Differences are significant at the 95% confidence level" else type.zscore <- "Differences are not significant."
}

#Convert to percentage
type.v <- type.v/sum(type.v)*100
type.gp <- type.gp/sum(type.gp)*100


```

```{r elder_setup}
  if(all(elder.z > 1.96 | elder.z < -1.96)==TRUE) elder.zscore <- "Differences are significant at the 95% confidence level" else elder.zscore <- "Differences are not significant."
```

```{r emp_setup}
#Employment Status Recode - EmpPct VIETNAM VETS, exclude Unemployed, extract std errors

}
```

## No major differences in earnings*. In terms of income** there are more Vietnam Veterans in brackets above $20K.

```{r pernpc_setup}

#Personal EarningsVIETNAM VETS,  extract std errors
pernpc.v <- svymean(~Pernpc, viet_design, na.rm=TRUE)
pernpc.se.v <- SE(pernpc.v)
#Personal Earnings Civilian Population, extract std errors
pernpc.gp <- svymean(~Pernpc, per55_design, na.rm=TRUE)
pernpc.se.gp <- SE(pernpc.gp)

#significance test if z < -1.96 or Z>1,96, results are significant at the 95 confidence level
pernpc.z <- c() 
for(i in 1:length(pernpc.v)){
  zscore<- (pernpc.v[i]-pernpc.gp[i])/sqrt(pernpc.se.v[i]^2+pernpc.se.gp[i]^2)
  pernpc.z <- c(zscore, pernpc.z)
  if(all(pernpc.z > 1.96 | pernpc.z < -1.96)==TRUE) pernpc.zscore <- "Differences are significant at the 95% confidence level" else pernpc.zscore <- "Differences are not significant."
}
#multiply by 100 to get percentages
pernpc.v <- pernpc.v*100
pernpc.gp <- pernpc.gp*100

```

## Of those recieving retirement income, a majority of Vietnam Veterans and non-Veterans get under $25K. There are about 7% more Vietnam Veterans in the $25K-$50K income range. 

```{r retpc_setup}

#Retirement Income VIETNAM VETS,  extract std errors
retpc.v <- svymean(~Retpc, viet_design, na.rm=TRUE)
retpc.se.v <- SE(retpc.v)
#Retirement Income Civilian Population, extract std errors
retpc.gp <- svymean(~Retpc, per55_design, na.rm=TRUE)
retpc.se.gp <- SE(retpc.gp)

#significance test if z < -1.96 or Z>1,96, results are significant at the 95 confidence level
retpc.z <- c() 
for(i in 1:length(retpc.v)){
  zscore<- (retpc.v[i]-retpc.gp[i])/sqrt(retpc.se.v[i]^2+retpc.se.gp[i]^2)
  retpc.z <- c(zscore, retpc.z)
  if(all(retpc.z > 1.96 | retpc.z < -1.96)==TRUE) retpc.zscore <- "Differences are significant at the 95% confidence level" else retpc.zscore <- "Differences are not significant."
}
#multiply by 100 to get percentages
retpc.v <- retpc.v*100
retpc.gp <- retpc.gp*100

```

```{r fs_setup}

#Food Stamp Civilian Population, extract std errors

  zscore<- (fs.v[i]-fs.gp[i])/sqrt(fs.se.v[i]^2+fs.se.gp[i]^2)
  fs.z <- c(zscore, fs.z)
  if(all(fs.z > 1.96 | fs.z < -1.96)==TRUE) fs.zscore <- "Differences are significant at the 95% confidence level" else fs.zscore <- "Differences are not significant."
}
```

## Nearly all Vietnam Veterans and non-Veterans have health insurance coverage. Though Vietnam Veterans tend to have less private and more public coverage. 

```{r hicov_setup}

  zscore<- (hicov.v[i]-hicov.gp[i])/sqrt(hicov.se.v[i]^2+hicov.se.gp[i]^2)

}
```
